conclusion: Analyze forces and use energy conservation principles
Identify forces and equations of motion for rods a and b
Calculate gravitational force on rod a as 1.5 N
Net force on rod a is F - m_a g sin theta - F_Aa = m_a a_a
Calculate gravitational force on rod b as 0.5 N
Net force on rod b is F_Ab - m_b g sin theta = m_b a_b
F_Aa = F_Ab because magnetic forces are equal and opposite
Induced current I = B L (v_a - v_b) / 2R
Ampere force F_A = B I L = B^2 L^2 (v_a - v_b) / 2R
Use energy conservation to relate work done and kinetic energy
Energy equation: F x_a - m_a g sin theta x_a - Q_a = 1/2 m_a v_a^2 + 1/2 m_b v_b^2
Displacement x_a = v_a/2 t using average velocity
Displacement x_b = 1/2 v_b t for rod b starting from rest
x_a - x_b = 1/2 (v_a - v_b) t to determine time t
Solve for velocity v_b using known values
Force balance on rod a: 2 - 1.5 - F_A = 0.3 a_a
Energy equation: F x_a - 1.5 x_a - 0.12 = 0.15 + 0.05 v_b^2
Given v_a = 1 m/s, solve for v_b
Calculate x_a using energy equation and displacement relation to find v_b
Magnitude of velocity v_b of rod b is 0.25 m/s
Result follows from balancing forces, using energy conservation, and solving induced current relations
